Just...[...]
passages.content_zh:
然後很高興她有你來照顧她。

只是...[...]

passages.content: <[...]>She's sad that she couldn't come, but she understands.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>她很遺憾自己不能來，但她懂。

passages.content: ...Alright.

Alright, enough moping about, tiny! It's time for combat
practice!
passages.content_zh:
好吧，夠悶悶不樂了，小！戰鬥的時間到了
練習！

passages.content: "Tiny"? But you're not that much taller than I am!
passages.content_zh: “微小的”？但你並沒有比我高多少！

passages.content:
HEY! No back-talk! Get out there and kill, soldier! YOU HAVE
YOUR ORDERS!
passages.content_zh:
嘿！不許頂嘴！出去殺戮吧，士兵！你有
您的訂單！

passages.content: Ahhhh!

As  bumps into , the demon girl catches her in a
hug and begins petting her head to calm her down.
passages.content_zh:
正巧撞上，魔女用力抓住了她。
擁抱並開始撫摸她的頭以使她平靜下來。

passages.content:
, stop yelling at her! She's only a child! We're going to
take today nice and slow.
passages.content_zh:
，別再罵她了！她還只是個孩子啊！我們要去
今天過得愉快而緩慢。

passages.content:
Are you kidding me? How do you expect to make any
progress when you're coddling her like that?
passages.content_zh:
你在開玩笑吧？您期望如何做出任何
當你這樣溺愛她時，進步了嗎？

passages.content:
We'll get there, but we can't just send her out into an undead-
infested dungeon on her own. That's just mean!

Isn't that right, ?
passages.content_zh:
我們會到達那裡，但我們不能只是把她送進不死族裡——
獨自出沒的地牢。這簡直就是卑鄙！

是不是這樣啊？

passages.content: Mrrrrmrrmrmrrrrr!
passages.content_zh: 嗚嗚嗚！

passages.content:
After a terrific struggle,  gets her face out of 's
boobs and gasps for air.
passages.content_zh:
經過一番激烈的掙扎，她的臉終於露出來了
胸部和喘氣。

passages.content: Lemme go! I can't breathe in there!
passages.content_zh: 讓我走吧！我在那裡無法呼吸！

passages.content: ...OH! ...I'm so sorry!

<[...]>You know what? I think maybe I should lead 's
training today. You two can be my assistants, okay?
passages.content_zh:
<[...]>你知道嗎？我想也許我應該領導
今天訓練。你們兩個可以當我的助手，好嗎？

passages.content: Right!
If you insist...
passages.content_zh: 如果你堅持...

passages.content:
Together, you introduce  to the challenges of fighting
Magico minions while keeping her safe from any real harm.

Her acid magic tears through skeleton hordes effortlessly, and
for other foes, you teach her how to fight effectively with her staff.
passages.content_zh:
你們一起迎接戰鬥的挑戰
Magico 奴才們同時保護她免受任何真正的傷害。

她的酸魔法可以毫不費力地撕裂骷髏群，並且
對於其他敵人，你教她如何用她的員工有效地戰鬥。

passages.content:
With  healing her when needed and  intercepting
blows from deadlier foes,  emerges from the dungeon
much more confident and knowledgeable than when she entered.

With the training day a success, you all return to camp.
passages.content_zh:
在需要時治愈她並攔截
來自更致命的敵人的打擊，從地牢中出現
比她進來時更有自信和知識淵博。

隨著訓練日的成功，大家都返回營地。

passages.content: The blue flame jumps from the lamp into the torch on its own.
passages.content_zh: 藍色火焰自行從燈中跳入火炬中。

passages.content:
The source of the ward is that torch over there.

Just light it up and the ward should disappear.
passages.content_zh:
結界的來源就是那邊的火把。

只要點亮它，病房就會消失。

passages.content: Leave it to me! Fire's my specialty.
passages.content_zh: 交給我吧！火是我的專長。

passages.content:
Lighting this torch should get rid of the ward, assuming it's
the source of it.
passages.content_zh:
點燃這個火把應該會擺脫守衛，假設它是
它的來源。

passages.content: <[...]>Crap, I don't have matches.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>糟糕，我沒有火柴。

passages.content: Don't worry, fire's my specialty.
passages.content_zh: 別擔心，火是我的專長。

passages.content:
shoots a spark from her fingertip, but the torch remains
unlit.
passages.content_zh:
從她的指尖射出火花，但火炬仍然存在
未點亮。

passages.content: Huh, maybe it needs a bit more.
passages.content_zh: 呵呵，也許還需要一點。

passages.content: ...It didn't work?
passages.content_zh: ……沒成功？

passages.content: <[...]>Guess we're going to have to find another way.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>我想我們必須找到另一種方法。

passages.content:
It's some kind of ward.

I don't think we can just force our way in, it's just too
strong.
passages.content_zh:
這是某種病房。

我不認為我們可以強行闖入，這太過分了
強。

passages.content:
But don't worry, there's always a way to break this kind
of ward.

We just have to find out how.
passages.content_zh:
但別擔心，總有辦法打破這個局面
病房的。

我們只需要找出方法。

passages.content: The source of the ward is clearly that torch on the wall.
passages.content_zh: 結界的來源顯然就是牆上的火把。

passages.content: 500 were found!
passages.content_zh: 已找到 500 個！

passages.content: A cold, blue flame burns inside this lantern.
passages.content_zh: 燈籠內燃燒著冰冷的藍色火焰。

passages.content:
The magic in this lantern is similar to what we saw earlier
in the wards. It must be the key to dispelling them.
passages.content_zh:
這個燈籠的魔法和我們之前看到的很相似
在病房裡。這一定是驅散他們的關鍵。

passages.content: <[...]>This looks important. Better take it with us.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>這看起來很重要。最好把它和我們一起帶走。

passages.content: Spectral Lantern was found!
passages.content_zh: 幽靈燈籠被發現了！

passages.content: Garak's Glyph was found!
passages.content_zh: 蓋拉克雕文被發現！

passages.content: We need more, ! Much more.
passages.content_zh: 我們需要更多，！更多。

passages.content:
I'm doing my best, Garak, but I can't just keep draining the
other girls like this!
passages.content_zh:
我已經盡力了，蓋拉克，但我不能只是繼續耗盡能量
其他女孩也這樣！

passages.content: <Garak>Nonsense, ! They still have plenty of lifeforce.
passages.content_zh: <加拉克>廢話！他們還有充足的生命力。

passages.content:
For now, but if I keep this up, there might be some permanent
damage!
passages.content_zh:
現在，但如果我繼續這樣做，可能會有一些永久性的
損壞！

passages.content:
<Garak>Tsk, tsk, tsk... .

Do you think your brother would hesitate to sacrifice a few
insignificant girls to fulfill his ambitions?
passages.content_zh:
<加拉克>嘖嘖嘖…

你認為你的兄弟會猶豫犧牲一些嗎？
微不足道的女孩來實現他的野心？

passages.content: ...No. No, he would not.
passages.content_zh: ....不。不，他不會。

passages.content:
<Garak>Then go forth and gather the lifeforce we need to set me
free, and you will have the power you desire.
passages.content_zh:
<Garak>然後去收集我們需要的生命力來安置我
自由，你將擁有你想要的力量。

passages.content:
, what's this talk about draining lifeforce?

And who's that weird-looking, talking staff?
passages.content_zh:
，這說的是什麼耗盡生命力？

那個長相怪異、說話很奇怪的工作人員是誰？

passages.content:
and her freak clique?

How did you get in here!?
passages.content_zh:
還有她的怪異集團？

你怎麼進來的！ ？

passages.content: <[...]>I think that staff is the Magico, !
passages.content_zh: <[...]>我認為工作人員是Magico，！

passages.content:
You mean 's working with a Magico? But she's a Magical
Girl, like us...
passages.content_zh:
你的意思是和 Magico 一起工作？但她是個魔法師
姑娘，跟我們一樣...

passages.content: Filthy traitor.
passages.content_zh: 骯髒的叛徒。

passages.content: Shut up! You don't know anything about me!
passages.content_zh: 住口！你對我一無所知！

passages.content:
<Garak>Calm down, ! Can't you see how convenient this is?
A new source of lifeforce came to us all by itself.
passages.content_zh:
<加拉克>冷靜點！你看不出這有多方便嗎？
一種新的生命力泉源自然而然地來到了我們身邊。

passages.content:
<Garak>Pathetic!

THAT WAS PATHETIC, \NU[4]!
passages.content_zh:
<加拉克>可悲！

這太可悲了，\NU[4]！

passages.content: But... I was outnumbered...
passages.content_zh: 但是……我寡不敵眾……

passages.content:
<Garak>Pah! If that is all you have, you are never going to be an
Empress. Just give up now and let your brother take the
throne.
passages.content_zh:
<加拉克>呸！如果這就是你所擁有的一切，你永遠不會成為一個
皇后。現在就放棄吧，讓你的兄弟來接手吧
王座。

passages.content: But I tried so hard...
passages.content_zh: 但我已經很努力了...

passages.content:
<Garak>Are those tears?

You are even more pitiful than I thought! A weakling like
you couldn't rule a pig-farm, much less an Empire.
passages.content_zh:
<Garak>那是眼淚嗎？

你比我想像的還要可憐！像一個弱者
你無法統治一個養豬場，更別說統治一個帝國了。

passages.content: Stop bullying , you stupid staff!
passages.content_zh: 別再欺負人了，你們這些愚蠢的員工！

passages.content: Garak? Garak!? No, I need him!
passages.content_zh: 加拉克？加拉克！ ？不，我需要他！

passages.content: <[...]>Why were you working with a Magico, ?
passages.content_zh: <[...]>為什麼要與 Magico 合作？

passages.content:
He was going to help me defeat my brother.

With father dead, he's going to take the throne and kill me.
passages.content_zh:
他要幫助我打敗我的兄弟。

父親死了，他就會奪取王位並殺死我。

passages.content: <[...]>Your own brother's going to kill you!?
passages.content_zh: <[...]>你自己的兄弟會殺了你！ ？

passages.content: He's tried doing it before.
passages.content_zh: 他以前嘗試過這樣做。

passages.content: Don't worry, . We'll protect you.
passages.content_zh: 不用擔心， 。我們會保護你。

passages.content: <[...]>Wait, we will?
passages.content_zh: <[...]>等等，我們會嗎？

passages.content:
\fiYou\fi are going to protect me?

What can a trio of losers like you do for me?
passages.content_zh:
\fi你\fi會保護我嗎？

像你們這樣的三個失敗者能為我做什麼？

passages.content: Well, we just beat you and Garak for one.
passages.content_zh: 好吧，我們剛剛擊敗了你和蓋瑞克。

passages.content: ...Good point.
passages.content_zh: ……好點。

passages.content:
\fiYou\fi are going to protect me?

What can a pair of losers like you do for me?
passages.content_zh:
\fi你\fi會保護我嗎？

你們兩個廢物能幫我做什麼？

passages.content: ...On the other hand, you did defeat Garak. Hmmm...
passages.content_zh: ……另一方面，你確實打敗了加拉克。嗯...

passages.content:
I guess you can be my minions, at least until I find someone
better.
passages.content_zh:
我想你可以成為我的爪牙，至少在我找到某人之前
更好。

passages.content: Yay, now we are all frien-[...]
passages.content_zh: 是的，現在我們都是朋友了-[...]

passages.content: Wait, minions? I don't want to be a minion...
passages.content_zh: 等等，小黄人？我不想當小人...

passages.content:
So, are we going back to the camp or are you going to just
stand there, gawking all day?
passages.content_zh:
那麼，我們要回營地還是你就直接去
整天站在那裡發呆？

passages.content: I need to rest after the beating you gave me!
passages.content_zh: 被你打了之後我需要休息！

passages.content: How can someone be so self-centered?
passages.content_zh: 怎麼會有人這麼以自我為中心呢？

passages.content: <[...]>I have to agree with . I can't believe we rescued her.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>我必須同意。我不敢相信我們救了她

passages.content:
<[...]>I guess it was too much to expect some gratitude from
a selfish bitch like her.
passages.content_zh:
<[...]>我想期望得到一些感激之情太過分了
像她這樣自私的婊子。

passages.content:
Now, now.

I'm sure that deep inside,  is a good girl.
passages.content_zh:
現在，現在。

我確信她內心深處是個好女孩。

passages.content:
So are we going or not?

Come on, minions, I don't have all day!
passages.content_zh:
那我們去還是不去？

來吧，小小兵，我沒有一整天的時間！

passages.content: ...Very, very deep inside.
passages.content_zh: ……內心非常非常深。

passages.content:
will now join your party for training.

Be careful; she does not know about your secret yet. Be
sure you can trust her before revealing it.
passages.content_zh:
現在將加入您的隊伍進行訓練。

當心;她還不知道你的秘密。是
確保在透露之前你可以相信她。

passages.content: <[...]>She's too strong...

They have been beaten, Garak, but what are we going to do
now? They know our secret!
passages.content_zh:
他們被打敗了，蓋拉克，但我們該怎麼辦
現在？他們知道我們的秘密！

passages.content:
<Garak>Do not concern yourself with such things. Simply place those
maggots in front of my sarcophagus...\fi I\fr will ensure your
continued safety.
passages.content_zh:
<Garak>不要擔心這種事。只需放置那些
我的石棺前有蛆...\fi 我\fr 將確保你
持續安全。

passages.content: <Garak>Now, witness my power!
passages.content_zh: <加拉克>現在，見證我的力量吧！

passages.content:
You turned them into statues? But I can still feel lifeforce
flowing inside of them.
passages.content_zh:
你把它們變成雕像了？但我依然能感受到生命力
在他們裡面流動。

passages.content: <Garak>But of course, . After all, in a way they are still alive.
passages.content_zh: <Garak>但是當然，。畢竟，從某種程度上來說，他們還活著。

passages.content:
<Garak>They wouldn't be able to provide the lifeforce we need for
my resurrection otherwise.
passages.content_zh:
<Garak>他們無法提供我們所需的生命力
否則我的復活。

passages.content:
<Centaur>Oh dear, I'm trapped.

What am I going to do now?
passages.content_zh:
<半人马>天哪，我被困住了。

我現在要做什麼？

passages.content: <[...]>What the-? Is that woman half-horse!?
passages.content_zh: <[...]>什麼-？那個女人是半馬嗎！ ？

passages.content: <Centaur>Aaaahhh!
passages.content_zh: <半人馬>啊啊啊！

passages.content: Shhh! You'll attract monsters if you keep screaming like that.
passages.content_zh: 噓！如果你繼續這樣尖叫，就會吸引怪物。

passages.content: Please calm down. We won't hurt you.
passages.content_zh: 請冷靜。我們不會傷害你。

passages.content: <Centaur>Oh! Sorry about that. I didn't see you.
passages.content_zh: <半人馬>哦！對此感到抱歉。我沒有看到你。

passages.content:
Don't worry about it. This place is a bit unnerving after all.

But what're you doing in this monster-infested tomb?
passages.content_zh:
別擔心。這個地方畢竟有點不安。

但你在這個怪物出沒的墳墓裡做什麼？

passages.content:
<Centaur>Well, I was gathering herbs on the mountains when I saw
this door carved into a cliff.

I knew I should've kept away, but curiosity got the better
of me.
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>嗯，我正在山上採集草藥時我看到了
這扇門雕刻在懸崖上。

我知道我應該遠離，但好奇心佔了上風
我的。

passages.content:
<Centaur>Everything was going fine until I felt something moving under
my hooves and that huge column fell.
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>一切都很順利，直到我感覺到有東西在下面移動
我的蹄子和那根巨大的柱子掉了下來。

passages.content: <[...]>Seems like you stepped on a trap.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>你好像踩到陷阱了。

passages.content: Don't you know curiosity killed the cat?
passages.content_zh: 你不知道好奇心害死貓嗎？

passages.content: Well, good thing we found you. You can come with us.
passages.content_zh: 嗯，幸好我們找到你了。你可以和我們一起去。

passages.content:
<Centaur>Errr, how should I put this... I don't really have the body
for rope climbing.
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>呃，該怎麼說呢…我真的沒有身體
用於攀爬繩索。

passages.content:
Oh, right, you're a centaur... Maybe we can tie the rope
around you and hoist you out of the hole?
passages.content_zh:
哦，對了，你是半人馬…也許我們可以把繩子綁起來
圍繞著你並把你從洞裡拉出來？

passages.content: <[...]>There's really no way we can lift her, .
passages.content_zh: <[...]>我們真的沒有辦法抬起她，。

passages.content:
<Centaur>I'm not that heavy! I only weigh around 900 pounds.

That's not much for a centaur.
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>我沒那麼重！我的體重只有900磅左右。

對半人馬來說這還不算什麼。

passages.content: <Centaur>Though I suppose it's a bit too much for you girls.
passages.content_zh: <半人馬>不過我認為這對你們女孩來說有點太多了。

passages.content:
<Centaur>Guess I'm stuck in here for good.

*Sigh*

What a crappy way to go...
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>我想我會永遠被困在這裡了。

*嘆息*

這是多麼蹩腳的路啊…

passages.content:
<[...]>Don't worry; I know somebody who can help you.

, are you there?
passages.content_zh:
<[...]>別擔心；我認識一個人可以幫助你。

， 你在嗎？

passages.content: You know I'm always here, .
passages.content_zh: 你知道我一直都在這裡。

passages.content: <[...]>Do you think you can help us with this situation?
passages.content_zh: <[...]>您認為您可以幫助我們解決這種情況嗎？

passages.content:
Let's see; I'll have to cast a teleport spell and adjust it a bit
to be able to translocate an average horse's mass...
passages.content_zh:
讓我們來看看;我得施展傳送咒語並稍微調整一下
能夠轉移平均馬的質量......

passages.content: Yes. It shouldn't be a problem to send her back home.
passages.content_zh: 是的。送她回家應該不成問題。

passages.content:
<Centaur>Oh, thank you, I thought I was a goner!

I don't have anything with me, but if you pass through our
encampment, please come and visit me. I'll fix you a nice
meal.
passages.content_zh:
<半人馬>哦，謝謝你，我以為我已經死了！

我身上什麼都沒有，但如果你經過我們的
營地，請來拜訪我。我會給你一個好的
餐。

passages.content: <Kaylin>My name is Kaylin, by the way.
passages.content_zh: <凱琳>順便說一句，我叫凱琳。

passages.content: <[...]>Good thing we were able to help Kaylin.
passages.content_zh: <[...]>幸好我們能夠幫助凱琳。

passages.content: Yes, Magical Girls were made to help those in need.
passages.content_zh: 是的，魔法少女就是為了幫助有需要的人而生的。

passages.content: I'm glad she's gone...
passages.content_zh: 我很高興她走了...

passages.content:
The way these two were ogling her breasts was getting
tiresome.
passages.content_zh:
這兩個人盯著她的胸部的方式越來越
煩人的。

passages.content: The way  was ogling her breasts was getting tiresome.

It's pretty simple too:
Define a parallel process which switches the lights
on or off. Since it's a parallel process, it works
map-wide.

There's a problem though:
If you have a talk-box open like now, then all parallel
processes are halted/act odd (like icon bubbles).

"But why is that?" It's actually quite simple.

For this, you make an event that has a move route
which includes the switch-switching on repeat.
Alternatively forgo the parallel process entirely
and just go with move-routes.

The latter may require some exact placement
planning though, so it's less advisable on bigger
maps.

This area is for testing shadows.

Left-most is the "beyond" shadow.
This type goes above everything except
what is defined in the exception list like
that purple flame.

The second is the "above" shadow. This
goes above everything except events set
to "above" or tiles marked with the *.

The last is the "semi" shadow. This goes
below events that are at least "Same as
Characters", but above tiles marked "O"
or "X".

It is best used for shadow edges like
over there at the opening.
You could also use it for shadow illusions.

Also, hexa/penta/octagrams don't work
with the shadows because they are always
below the player, so be careful when
placing them.

Same for flames "under" * tiles or any
"Above Characters" events.
Use care and it's ok.

Also be careful with pictures:

-pictures in slots 01-50 are "below"

-pictures in slots 51-100 are "above"

Let me demonstrate.

I will show a couple images and
animations (slots 99 and 100 are for
transitions).
This is in slot 1.
This is in slot 50.
This is in slot 51.
And this is in slot 98.

Screenshake animations for example don't play
above picture slot 50, only 50 and lower.
This is all handled by kinu's script.
And that's all.

And so, once more, you have no choice but to abandon your
old life and start anew in a strange new world.

You return with Salenia to the mermaid kingdom.

As you travel, you attempt to check in on  again and
again, but get no response. Whatever else the crown did,
it appears to have erased the entity living in your mind.

Strange though she may have been, you cannot help feeling
sad about her disappearance.

The days pass by in a flurry of activity. Your initial fears
about ruling over a kingdom you barely know fade quickly,
as the crown seems to provide you with whatever answers
you need.

Your old mind and memories remain intact, but with each
passing day, not only do you find yourself more comfortable
in your new body, but you also begin acting more confident
and regal.

True to your word, when the remaining Cutie Knights graduate,
you invite them to your first royal ball to celebrate... but
sadly,  is too busy to attend, and  left in her ship
as soon as she was able to.

Even so, you have a wonderful time seeing  and
 again, as well as your replacement on the team, Daisy.
She might not be overly helpful in a fight, but she makes
for an excellent mascot and scout.

From what you hear,  is doing wonderfully as the new
team leader... though she only blushes and hides beneath
her beret when people tell her so.

As she leaves,  promises to visit as often as she can,
which turns out to be more often than you expected.

When she is not fighting Magicos, she spends much of her
time with you.

Free of the camp's rules and your own concerns about your
new gender, your relationship blossoms, though 's
particular bloodline means marriage is out of the question.

Even so, she is a common sight in your court, and one of
your most prized and honoured concubines. You even fight
alongside her any time she faces a particularly nasty aquatic
foe.

Neither of you are ever quite so happy as you are during
your times together.

When the night is over and everyone returns home, you
find yourself disappointed. It was good to see those who
came, but you had hoped to see  once more.

Months go by, during which you adapt to your new life.

Things are fine... but one day, when a mysterious package
arrives for you delivered by a strange alien drone, your
heart skips a beat.

You open the package. Inside, you find a magnificent
necklace, decorated with jewels you cannot identify. The
note within simply reads, "To the Queen of My Heart".

Every few months another such gift arrives, each one a
priceless treasure, and each one containing the same note.
You never wear them in public, but prize them when you
are alone.

You move on with your life, taking lovers and contemplating
marriage, but you feel happiest when you think of the girl out
there in space who still thinks of you.

Eventually, however, the gifts become less and less common.
One day, a letter arrives, reading only, "I wish I could share
all I've done with you, but I have to let you go. Goodbye."

You wipe away a tear before tucking away the note. You
understand her perfectly. Hopefully, you can both find
happiness.

As the party comes to a close, you are not too surprised to
find that  has decided to stay behind. Apparently, the
idea of life in a community where her powers are celebrated
had some appeal.

Over the next few days, you share your life here with her,
delighting her with all the marvels of your new kingdom.

Thankfully, 's credentials as a promising new
enchantress make her an immediate celebrity among your
people, and she agrees to begin training.

Better still, it turns out  is naturally gifted at mermaid
song magic. This makes her something of a celebrity among
your people, and she agrees to begin training.

Being a former land-dweller and an ex-Magical Girl, there
are some among your subjects with issues about your rule.

The notes read:

The bestiary records all enemies you naturally encounter.
Killing an enemy will provide a description of that enemy.

The bestiary will also attempt to determine an enemy's
abilities if they are put to the test:

-Attacking them may reveal their defences, while getting
hit by them may reveal their strength

In short: go and kill things to fill it out.

- Melancia :)

The notes read:

The Scan Scope, if used on a highlighted enemy by pressing
Shift, will reveal that enemy's attributes, such as its strength
or magical aptitude.

It will also reveal their defences against various elements
or status effects.

When combined with a bestiary, the Scan Scope will fill out all
statistics on an enemy immediately, so use it to study
enemies and exploit their weaknesses.

Some enemies might be able to fool the Scan Scope
regarding their true powers or cause an error.

Note that since it is a prototype, there might be unforeseen
errors.
(Sorry, still trying to fix those^^' - Melancia)

There was an error accessing cross-game save data.

In order to resolve it, please do the following:

1) Open Windows File Explorer.
2) In the address bar, type in "%appdata%" (no quotes)
3) Copy the address it takes you to. It should look like:
C:\\Users\\YOUR_WINDOWS_USER_NAME\\AppData\\Roaming

4) Navigate to your Magical Camp game directory.
5) Open "appdata.txt"
6) Paste in the address you copied earlier.
7) Save and close the file. File encoding should be UTF-8.

Until you follow these instructions, cross-game save data
features will not work.

Thank you, and sorry for the inconvenience.
